congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Foreign Relations Authorization Act for Fiscal Years 2006 and 2007
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 2601, to authorize appropriations for the Department of State for fiscal years 2006 and 2007, by a recorded vote of 351 ayes to 78 noes, Roll No. 399. The bill was also considered yesterday, July 19.

congVote.result: So (two-thirds having voted in favor thereof) the rules were suspended and the resolution, as amended, was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Calling for free and fair parliamentary elections in the Republic of Azerbaijan
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>Debated on July 18: H. Res. 326, calling for free and fair parliamentary elections in the Republic of Azerbaijan, by a 2/3 yea and nay vote of 416 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 400.

titleInfo.title: DEPARTMENT OF STATE, FOREIGN OPERATIONS, AND RELATED PROGRAMS APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2006

name.namePart: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

extension.searchTitle: DEPARTMENT OF STATE, FOREIGN OPERATIONS, AND RELATED PROGRAMS APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2006; Congressional Record Vol. 151, No. 99

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 98 yeas to 1 nay (Vote No. 197), Senate passed H.R. 3057, making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2006, after taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:<P/>McConnell (for Lugar/Leahy) Amendment No. 1293, to promote reform of the multilateral development banks.<P/>By a unanimous vote of 98 yeas (Vote No. 195), Landrieu Modified Amendment No. 1245, to express the sense of the Senate regarding the use of funds for orphans, and displaced and abandoned children.

<P/>By 98 yeas to 1 nay (Vote No. 197), Senate passed H.R. 3057, making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2006, after taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:<P/>McConnell (for Lugar/Leahy) Amendment No. 1293, to promote reform of the multilateral development banks.<P/>By a unanimous vote of 98 yeas (Vote No. 195), Landrieu Modified Amendment No. 1245, to express the sense of the Senate regarding the use of funds for orphans, and displaced and abandoned children.<P/>By 86 yeas to 12 nays (Vote No. 196), Chambliss Amendment No. 1271, to prevent funds from being made available to provide assistance to a country which has refused to extradite certain individuals to the United States.

congVote.result: Mr. KOHL. Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that on record vote No. 196 regarding the Chambliss amendment, that I be recorded as having voted ``aye'' instead of my previous vote against the amendment. I understand this change will not affect the outcome of the vote.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 98 yeas to 1 nay (Vote No. 197), Senate passed H.R. 3057, making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2006, after taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:<P/>McConnell (for Lugar/Leahy) Amendment No. 1293, to promote reform of the multilateral development banks.<P/>By a unanimous vote of 98 yeas (Vote No. 195), Landrieu Modified Amendment No. 1245, to express the sense of the Senate regarding the use of funds for orphans, and displaced and abandoned children.<P/>By 86 yeas to 12 nays (Vote No. 196), Chambliss Amendment No. 1271, to prevent funds from being made available to provide assistance to a country which has refused to extradite certain individuals to the United States.

congVote.result: The bill (H.R. 3057), as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 98 yeas to 1 nay (Vote No. 197), Senate passed H.R. 3057, making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2006, after taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:
